ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark
ygData.msgSnippet: Wasn t meant to be a flame toward you.  It was a statement about Verant s attitude toward bards. ... From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@home.com] Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
Wasn't meant to be a flame toward you. It was a statement about Verant's
attitude toward bards.

-----Original Message-----
From: Kevin L. Crawford [mailto:Lyrnia@...]
Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2000 12:00 PM
To: eqbards@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark


Uhh like I said, our 'skills' Parry and Riposte
didn't come till 53

NOBODY made 53 during the beta ;) At least none of the bards did.

So there was never a need for a trainer ;p

As to "Why do the others have them"
If I had to hazard a guess: Because there are a shitload more of them than
there are bards. My real answer though is:
"Don't know, don't care, really don't need one there anyway". There's a
song vendor. I personally don't see a need for a bard "Trainer" neither do
most folks.

HEH that's the last time I answer a question here. Tired of the flames.

Kev



----- Original Message -----
From: "Peck White" <pwhite@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Tuesday, June 20, 2000 10:47 AM
Subject: RE: [eqbards] Bard Training in Kunark


> So...
>
> why was it ok for the bard testers to take the boat back to the old world
to
> train but it wasn't ok for the Druids and the Paladins and the Rangers and
> the Warriors and the Enchanters and the Magicians and the Wizards... ???
>
> What plethora of post 50 skills necessitated the trainers for them?
>
> Lyrnia Jongleur wrote:
>
> There is a Bard Song Vendor in Kunark. There aren't any trainers because
we
> didn't get any skills after 50 (till 53). Those skills that were thrown
in
> were an AFTER THOUGHT (emphasis mine) and the bards in the beta just went
to
> kelethin on the elven boat (or grabbed a gate/port) to train.
>
